api_endpoint.description: The URL to use for the DigitalOcean API.

http_retry_max.description: The maximum number of retries on a failed API request.

http_retry_wait_max.description: The maximum wait time (in seconds) between failed API requests.

http_retry_wait_min.description: The minimum wait time (in seconds) between failed API requests.

requests_per_second.description: The rate of requests per second to limit the HTTP client.

spaces_access_id.description: The access key ID for Spaces API operations.

spaces_endpoint.description: The URL to use for the DigitalOcean Spaces API.

spaces_secret_key.description: The secret access key for Spaces API operations.

token.description: The token key for API operations.

active_deployment_id.description: The ID the App's currently active deployment

created_at.description: The date and time of when the App was created

default_ingress.description: The default URL to access the App

updated_at.description: The date and time of when the App was last updated

urn.description: The uniform resource identifier for the app

id.description: The ID of the dedicated egress IP.

ip.description: The IP address of the dedicated egress IP.

status.description: The status of the dedicated egress IP: 'UNKNOWN', 'ASSIGNING', 'ASSIGNED', or 'REMOVED'

block.description: The dedicated egress IP addresses associated with the app.

features.description: List of features which is applied to the app

name.description: The name of the app. Must be unique across all apps in the same account.

region.description: The slug for the DigitalOcean data center region hosting the app

cluster_name.description: The name of the underlying DigitalOcean DBaaS cluster. This is required for production databases. For dev databases, if cluster_name is not set, a new cluster will be provisioned.

db_name.description: The name of the MySQL or PostgreSQL database to configure.

db_user.description: The name of the MySQL or PostgreSQL user to configure.

production.description: Whether this is a production or dev database.

version.description: The version of the database engine.

wildcard.description: Indicates whether the domain includes all sub-domains, in addition to the given domain.

zone.description: If the domain uses DigitalOcean DNS and you would like App Platform to automatically manage it for you, set this to the name of the domain on your account.

key.description: The name of the environment variable.

scope.description: The visibility scope of the environment variable.

type.description: The type of the environment variable.

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

source_dir.description: An optional path to the working directory to use for the build.

block.description: Alert policies for the app component

allow_credentials.description: Whether browsers should expose the response to the client-side JavaScript code when the request’s credentials mode is `include`. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header.

allow_headers.description: The set of allowed HTTP request headers. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

allow_methods.description: The set of allowed HTTP methods. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header.

expose_headers.description: The set of HTTP response headers that browsers are allowed to access. This configures the Access-Control-Expose-Headers header.

max_age.description: An optional duration specifying how long browsers can cache the results of a preflight request. This configures the Access-Control-Max-Age header. Example: `5h30m`.

block.description: The set of allowed CORS origins. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header.

path.description: Path specifies an route by HTTP path prefix. Paths must start with / and must be unique within the app.

preserve_path_prefix.description: An optional flag to preserve the path that is forwarded to the backend service.

allow_credentials.description: Whether browsers should expose the response to the client-side JavaScript code when the request’s credentials mode is `include`. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header.

allow_headers.description: The set of allowed HTTP request headers. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

allow_methods.description: The set of allowed HTTP methods. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header.

expose_headers.description: The set of HTTP response headers that browsers are allowed to access. This configures the Access-Control-Expose-Headers header.

max_age.description: An optional duration specifying how long browsers can cache the results of a preflight request. This configures the Access-Control-Max-Age header. Example: `5h30m`.

block.description: The set of allowed CORS origins. This configures the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header.

dockerfile_path.description: The path to a Dockerfile relative to the root of the repo. If set, overrides usage of buildpacks.

instance_count.description: The amount of instances that this component should be scaled to.

instance_size_slug.description: The instance size to use for this component.

kind.description: The type of job and when it will be run during the deployment process.

run_command.description: An optional run command to override the component's default.

source_dir.description: An optional path to the working directory to use for the build.

A DigitalOcean App Platform Spec

certificate_id.description: ID of a DigitalOcean managed TLS certificate for use with custom domains

created_at.description: The date and time (ISO8601) of when the CDN endpoint was created.

custom_domain.description: fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for custom subdomain, (requires certificate_id)

endpoint.description: fully qualified domain name (FQDN) to serve the CDN content

origin.description: fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the origin server

ttl.description: The amount of time the content is cached in the CDN

uuid.description: The unique universal identifier for the database replica.

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the floating ip

network.description: the type of network the load balancer is accessible from (EXTERNAL or INTERNAL)

target_load_balancer_ids.description: list of load balancer IDs to put behind a global load balancer

type.description: the type of the load balancer (GLOBAL or REGIONAL)

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the load balancer

certificate_name.description: name of certificate required for TLS handshaking

is_managed.description: flag indicating if domain is managed by DigitalOcean

ssl_validation_error_reasons.description: list of domain SSL validation errors

block.description: the list of domains required to ingress traffic to global load balancer

allow.description: the rules for ALLOWING traffic to the LB (strings in the form: 'ip:1.2.3.4' or 'cidr:1.2.0.0/16')

deny.description: the rules for DENYING traffic to the LB (strings in the form: 'ip:1.2.3.4' or 'cidr:1.2.0.0/16')

block.description: CDN specific configurations
configuration options for global load balancer

compare.description: The comparison operator to use for value

entities.description: The droplets to apply the alert policy to

email.description: List of email addresses to sent notifications to

channel.description: The Slack channel to send alerts to

block.description: List with details how to notify about the alert. Support for Slack or email.

created_at.description: the date and time when the project was created, (ISO8601)

environment.description: the environment of the project's resources

is_default.description: determine if the project is the default or not.

name.description: the human-readable name for the project

owner_id.description: the id of the project owner.

owner_uuid.description: the unique universal identifier of the project owner.

resources.description: the resources associated with the project

updated_at.description: the date and time when the project was last updated, (ISO8601)

resources.description: the resources associated with the project

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the reserved ip

acl.description: Canned ACL applied on bucket creation

endpoint.description: The FQDN of the bucket without the bucket name

force_destroy.description: Unless true, the bucket will only be destroyed if empty

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the bucket

allowed_headers.description: A list of headers that will be included in the CORS preflight request's Access-Control-Request-Headers. A header may contain one wildcard (e.g. x-amz-*).

allowed_methods.description: A list of HTTP methods (e.g. GET) which are allowed from the specified origin.

allowed_origins.description: A list of hosts from which requests using the specified methods are allowed. A host may contain one wildcard (e.g. http://*.example.com).

block.description: A container holding a list of elements describing allowed methods for a specific origin.

check_id.description: A unique identifier for a check.

comparison.description: The comparison operator used against the alert's threshold. Enum: 'greater_than' 'less_than

name.description: A human-friendly display name for the alert.

period.description: Period of time the threshold must be exceeded to trigger the alert. Enum '2m' '3m' '5m' '10m' '15m' '30m' '1h'

threshold.description: The threshold at which the alert will enter a trigger state. The specific threshold is dependent on the alert type.

type.description: The type of health check to perform. Enum: 'latency' 'down' 'down_global' 'ssl_expiry'

email.description: List of email addresses to sent notifications to

channel.description: The Slack channel to send alerts to

block.description: The notification settings for a trigger alert.

enabled.description: A boolean value indicating whether the check is enabled/disabled.

name.description: A human-friendly display name for the check.

regions.description: An array containing the selected regions to perform healthchecks from.

target.description: The endpoint to perform healthchecks on.

type.description: The type of health check to perform. Enum: 'ping' 'http' 'https'

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the volume.

created_at.description: The date and time of when the VPC was created

default.description: Whether or not the VPC is the default one for the region

description.description: A free-form description for the VPC

ip_range.description: The range of IP addresses for the VPC in CIDR notation

region.description: DigitalOcean region slug for the VPC's location

urn.description: The uniform resource name (URN) for the VPC

created_at.description: The date and time when the VPC was created

id.description: The ID of the VPC Peering

name.description: The name of the VPC Peering

status.description: The status of the VPC Peering

vpc_ids.description: The list of VPCs to be peered

droplet_limit.description: The total number of Droplets current user or team may have active at one time.

email.description: The email address used by the current user to register for DigitalOcean.

email_verified.description: If true, the user has verified their account via email. False otherwise.

floating_ip_limit.description: The total number of Floating IPs the current user or team may have.

status.description: This value is one of "active", "warning" or "locked".

status_message.description: A human-readable message giving more details about the status of the account.

uuid.description: The unique universal identifier for the current user.

active_deployment_id.description: The ID the App's currently active deployment

created_at.description: The date and time of when the App was created

default_ingress.description: The default URL to access the App

updated_at.description: The date and time of when the App was last updated

urn.description: The uniform resource identifier for the app

id.description: The ID of the dedicated egress IP.

ip.description: The IP address of the dedicated egress IP.

status.description: The status of the dedicated egress IP: 'UNKNOWN', 'ASSIGNING', 'ASSIGNED', or 'REMOVED'

block.description: The dedicated egress IP addresses associated with the app.

domains.description: domains for which the certificate was issued

not_after.description: expiration date and time of the certificate

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the domain

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results
One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results

backups.description: whether the Droplet has backups enabled

created_at.description: the creation date for the Droplet

disk.description: the size of the Droplets disk in gigabytes

image.description: the image id or slug of the Droplet

ipv6.description: whether the Droplet has ipv6 enabled

locked.description: whether the Droplet has been locked

memory.description: memory of the Droplet in megabytes

monitoring.description: whether the Droplet has monitoring enabled

private_networking.description: whether the Droplet has private networking enabled

region.description: the region that the Droplet instance is deployed in

size.description: the current size of the Droplet

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the Droplet

volume_ids.description: list of volumes attached to the Droplet

vpc_uuid.description: UUID of the VPC in which the Droplet is located

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results
One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results

droplet_id.description: the droplet id that the floating ip has been assigned to.

region.description: the region that the floating ip is reserved to

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the floating ip

distribution.description: distribution of the OS of the image

error_message.description: error message associated with the image

image.description: slug or id of the image

min_disk_size.description: minimum disk size required by the image

private.description: Is the image private or non-private

regions.description: list of the regions that the image is available in

size_gigabytes.description: size in GB of the image

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results
One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results

algorithm.description: algorithm used to determine which backend Droplet will be selected by a client

disable_lets_encrypt_dns_records.description: whether to disable automatic DNS record creation for Let's Encrypt certificates that are added to the load balancer

domains.description: the list of domains required to ingress traffic to global load balancer

droplet_ids.description: ids of the droplets assigned to the load balancer

droplet_tag.description: the name of a tag corresponding to droplets assigned to the load balancer

enable_backend_keepalive.description: whether HTTP keepalive connections are maintained to target Droplets

enable_proxy_protocol.description: whether PROXY Protocol should be used to pass information from connecting client requests to the backend service

firewall.description: the firewall rules for allowing/denying traffic to the load balancer

forwarding_rule.description: list of forwarding rules of the load balancer

glb_settings.description: configuration options for global load balancer

healthcheck.description: health check settings for the load balancer

http_idle_timeout_seconds.description: Specifies the idle timeout for HTTPS connections on the load balancer.

ip.description: public-facing IP address of the load balancer

network.description: the type of network the load balancer is accessible from (EXTERNAL or INTERNAL)

project_id.description: The ID of the project that the load balancer is associated with.

redirect_http_to_https.description: whether http requests will be redirected to https

region.description: the region that the load balancer is deployed in

size.description: the size of the load balancer

size_unit.description: the size of the load balancer.

status.description: current state of the Load Balancer

sticky_sessions.description: sticky sessions settings for the load balancer

target_load_balancer_ids.description: list of load balancer IDs to put behind a global load balancer

type.description: the type of the load balancer (GLOBAL or REGIONAL)

urn.description: the uniform resource name for the load balancer

vpc_uuid.description: UUID of the VPC in which the load balancer is located

updated_at.description: the date and time when the project was last updated, (ISO8601)
